snippet: As the Internet has opened the art market to the masses, the volume of fraud has vastly increased, experts say.
abstract: Volume of fraud in the Internet art market has vastly increased, with buyers regularly purchasing bogus masterworks for a fraction of what the authentic pieces would bring in a legitimate sale; trend is a component of a wider phenomenon in which the Internet has broadened the art market far beyond its traditions of wealth and exclusivity, helping turn the slogan 'art for everyone' into a reality.
lead_paragraph: As the Internet has opened the art market to the masses, the volume of fraud has vastly increased, experts say.

headline.seo: Growth in Online Art Market Brings More Fraud
headline.main: A Picasso Online for Just $450? Yes, It Is a Steal
headline.print_headline: A Picasso Online for Just $450? Yes, It Is a Steal
